alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued September 30 at 7:31PM EDT until October 01 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Coastal Indian River, Coastal Saint Lucie and Coastal Martin Counties. * WHEN...Until 2 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Rip currents are powerful channels of water flowing quickly away from shore, which occur most often at low spots or breaks in the sandbar and in the vicinity of structures such as jetties and piers. Heed the advice of lifeguards, beach patrol flags and signs. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Indian River; Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie
